0.user_question: There are 8510345 students playing tennis and twice that number playing volleyball. There are 18510345 boys and 22 girls playing soccer. If each student only participates in one group, how many students are there in total?

direct_answer.text: To find out the total number of students, we first need to calculate the number of people playing volleyball which would be twice as many as those who play tennis. That means Volleyball players count would be 8510345 (Tennis) times 2 equals 17020690. Next, sum up all these numbers along with Soccer player counts i.e., Boys plus Girls equaling 18510345+22=18510367. Finally add Tennis, Volleyball and Soccer totals together so it comes down to  8510345 (tennis)+17020690(volleyball)+18510367(soccer)= Total_students . Adding them results into Final
